"Can I come pick you up for dinner?"

"Sure," Hannah said, smiling to herself, "Come on over."

Since Luis lived close by, it didn't take him long to maneuver through traffic to Hannah's building, and was up the stairs and knocking on her door within ten minutes.

"Wow, that was fast!" exclaimed Hannah, as she opened the door and saw Luis already standing there.

Luis glanced at Hannah still in the clothes she had worn to work and smiled at her.

"You look great," he said, "like a very powerful businesswoman. Verrry sexy."

He growled at her playfully and she laughed at him.

"You are so full of it!" she said, conscious of the tingly feeling running down her spine.

"C'mon, let's go," Luis said, "I don't want dinner to burn."

"Huh?" asked Hannah, as he grabbed her hand and pulled her out the door.

"Yeah, I'm cooking for you tonight. Let's go before my smoke alarm evacuates the building!" Luis laughed as they headed down the stairs.

When they got to his building, Luis opened the passenger-side door for Hannah with a big grin on his face.

"See? Aren't I gallant?" Luis asked.

"Yeah, you have a big head too," teased Hannah.

They took the elevator to Luis's apartment, and Luis unlocked the door.

"Welcome to my humble abode!" Luis said, with ceremony, upon opening the door.
112211111121.title: Luis Calls Hannah

choices: Hannah goes to work the next morning.
Hannah does not go to work the next morning.
1122111111212.content:
Hannah walked into Luis's apartment only to stop dead in her tracks at the site of another girl sitting on his couch. Hannah immediately felt jealous, not only because she hadn't been expecting to see another girl at Luis's house, but also because the other girl was absolutely beautiful.

When Hannah stopped walking, Luis bumped into her as he followed her in.

"Hey -" he started, and then stopped as he saw the girl on his couch.

"Um, Katy, what are you doing here?" he asked, clearing his throat nervously. Luis stepped forward to see if anyone else was there, too.

Hannah stepped back towards the door, feeling absolutely mortified.

"Hey Luis," the girl he had called Katy said with a smile, "I just wanted to stop by to see you, and the door was open so I let myself in. I thought maybe you had made your old girlfriend dinner, but I see that maybe I'm interrupting something."

Katy had stood up while explaining and had given Luis a big hug, winking at Hannah over his shoulder at the part of her explanation that included the possibility of her interruption. Katy kissed Luis on the mouth while Hannah looked on, wide-eyed.

"Luis, I... have to go, I forgot that I have a business dinner tonight..." Hannah trailed off.

"No, Hannah, stay, please," Luis said, "Katy is just a friend from college, she's just leaving."

Luis gently pushed Katy towards the door, but Hannah was already there opening it.

"No, really, I have to go," said Hannah, "But I'll see you another time maybe."

Hannah closed the door behind her and hurried down the stairs and out onto the street. She couldn't believe that Luis had told her that he didn't have a girlfriend and that there had been a girl in his apartment! She could feel herself starting to form tears, but was angry that she was letting herself cry over Luis, who had done this to her once before.

Luis had always been such a social person and had been easily bored. He had always professed to never being bored with Hannah, but the summer after their senior year in high school, Hannah had known that Luis had been seen all over town with Lisa Barnett, even kissing her, while Hannah and Luis had been dating. That had been most of the reason why they hadn't kept in touch during their college years.

Hannah thought that she should have known better than to trust him again. She walked the entire mile to her building in high heel shoes that hurt her feet and caused blisters that she would remember for days afterward.

"It serves me right," she sniffed, "as she opened her apartment door and locked it behind her. I shouldn't have fallen for his charm again."

Hannah spent the rest of the evening crying, and turned off her phone, letting her voice mail pick up, but never checking it. She was hurt and didn't want to speak with Luis after the night's events. She went to bed early, taking two night-time Tylenols to help her sleep.

The next morning, she would get up and go to work like nothing had happened.
1122111111212.title: Hannah is Surprised

choices: Anna comes over to Hannah's house, bringing 3 other girlfriends.
Anna comes over to Hannah's house alone.
11221111112121.content:
The next morning, Hannah got up and went to work as planned. Her eyes were slightly pink from tears, and she was quieter than usual, as noticed by her co-workers.

"Hey, you okay?" asked Abby, one of Hannah's office-mates.

"Yeah, I'm fine," replied Hannah, listlessly.

At lunch time, Hannah trudged down to the cafe in the office building and ordered nothing but an orange juice. She sat in the corner, drinking it, when Anna plopped down next to her.

"I have been looking all over for you!!" Anna shrieked, in her typical fashion. "How was the other night with Luis??"

Hannah glared at Anna.

"Don't ask."

"What do you mean, 'don't ask'?"

"I mean, I wish I had never seen him again, is what I mean," Hannah replied, scowling, in a more vindictive tone than Anna had ever heard her use before.

Anna blinked in surprise.

"What happened?" Anna asked, in a softer tone than Hannah had ever heard her use before.

Hannah sighed and tried not to let tears fill her eyes again.

"Okay, well, after you left that night, I took Luis to the museum, and we stayed out until it was dark, and then we went to my house and made cookies and talked for a long time... It was so much fun, Anna, I was so excited about it, and the next day, I went to work so happy and I couldn't wait for later that night because he was going to call me again."

"Well... what was so bad about that?" Anna asked, confused, when Hannah paused.

"It wasn't that night that the bad things happened, it was the next night," Hannah said, with a sigh.

"Um, well? What happened the next night?" asked Anna, impatiently.

"Well.... he called me after work and came to pick me up because he was cooking me dinner-"

"That is so sweet!" Anna interrupted.

"AND," Hannah glared at Anna, "when I walked in the door, there was a gorgeous blonde sitting on his couch, and she got up and gave him a big hug and kiss and called herself his 'old girlfriend'."

"Oh my gosh," Anna nearly whispered, "Who was she?"

"I don't know, some girl named Katy. He said she was an old college friend, but I don't know why an old college friend from California would be living in New York."

Hannah sniffled.

Anna reached over and gave Hannah a hug.

"Hannah, don't cry. For one, you'll ruin your mascara and you still have half a day of work ahead of you. And for two, NO guy is worth crying over, especially a jerk like Luis."

"But he's not a jerk, Anna, I'm just stupid..."

The tears were rolling freely now.

"Hannah... 'Buck up, little camper,' as my brother always used to say to me," Anna encouraged, as she pulled a tissue out of her purse and wiped the black streaks off of Hannah's face. "Things will be better tomorrow, but for now, you need to get back to work okay? I'll call you tonight."

Hannah sniffled and nodded, and went back to work.
11221111112121.title: Hannah Tells Anna All About It

112211111121212.content:
Hannah came home from work, tired and dejected. She took a long shower and changed into the baggiest shorts and tee-shirt she had. She settled on the couch with a one-pound bag of Crispy M&M's and put her favorite chick flick in her VCR. As the movie started, there was a knock on the door.

Hannah got up from her seat and put her ear to the door to see if she could hear any sounds. She grumbled to herself as she made the decision to buy a peep-hole the next day so that she could see who it was. She wanted to avoid Luis at all costs and so didn't want to ask who it was for fear of informing Luis that she was actually home.

"Hannah, open the door for heaven's sake!" shouted Anna, her voice muffled on the other side of the door.

Relieved, Hannah opened the door to see Anna holding a grocery bag with what looked like the outlines of pints of Ben and Jerry's ice cream and holding the latest issue of Cosmo between her teeth as she rummaged through her purse for something.

Anna took the magazine out of her mouth to say, "Jeez, about time. What took you so long?"

"I don't know, I thought you might be Luis. I'm getting a peep-hole tomorrow."

"You are so paranoid, you freak! Check it out, Ben and Jerry's and Cosmo," Anna grinned. "We'll have you feeling better in no time."

"I don't WANT to feel better," Hannah sighed, "I LIKE wallowing in my own misery."

But in spite of herself, Hannah pulled out a pint of ice cream and dug in.

The girls spent the evening doing Cosmo quizzes and eating more ice cream than a person would think would fit in the stomachs of the two small-framed girls, and Hannah had to admit afterward that she did feel better.

At this point, Hannah's phone was still turned off and she hadn't checked her voice mail.

Anna started complaining about having called Hannah and left her several messages on voice mail but never receiving a call back.

"Sheesh, as if I'm not your best friend or something!" Anna said, glaring at Hannah.

"I haven't checked my voice mail in a while, I just don't want to hear from Luis," Hannah answered.

"Oh my gosh, I bet he's called. Oh please please please check your voice mail, I'm dying to know what he said!"

"You check if it you want to know so badly."

"Are you serious? Okay!"

Anna jumped up and ran to the phone and dialed Hannah's voice mail number and began to listen to the messages. Hannah pretended not to be paying attention, instead fiercely picking at the paint on her old baggy shorts.

After several minutes of silence on Anna's part, she hung up the phone and looked at Hannah.

"I think you should call him," she said, gravely.

"Why?" asked Hannah, "What did he say?"
112211111121212.title: Ben and Jerry's and Cosmo - Better Than Prozac

1122111111212121.content:
"Well..." Anna said, looking guilty, "The only messages there were from me."

Hannah stared at her in disbelief.

"He didn't call?"

"Well, you're the one who didn't want to talk to him!"

"I know, but I still thought that he would call..."

Hannah trailed off in tears. She didn't know what to think about Luis not calling her back. All she could think of was that he hadn't wanted to call her back or that he was with Katy. She tried to make herself feel better by imagining that he had been hit by a car and hospitalized after running after her. She knew that wouldn't be the case.
1122111111212121.title: He Didn't Call

11221111112121211.content:
Anna watched with concern as Hannah sat quietly, tears falling down her face. She got up and gave Hannah a hug.

"Oh Hannah, I'm sorry, I shouldn't have insisted on checking your messages."

"No, it's not your fault," Hannah sobbed.

Anna felt helpless as the friend who had always previously comforted her now needed comforting. It felt like watching her mom cry or something, she thought.

"Well," Hannah sniffed, "There's only one thing for me to do. Go to bed so that I can get up tomorrow morning for work and continue to live my life."

"Hannah, you really don't have to be so stoic. It's okay to be sad about things."

"It's not okay to be sad about this. Luis did this to me once before, and I shouldn't have trusted him, but I made the mistake and now I have to deal with it. I refuse to spend my time crying over someone who doesn't even think of me!" Hannah's voice wavered as she spoke.

Anna wisely (for once) didn't say anything in response but just held her best friend as she cried.

Anna offered to stay the night, but Hannah told her that she just wanted to be alone for a while, so after Anna left, Hannah took a long shower and went to bed. She had a hard time falling asleep because everytime she thought of Luis (which was very frequently), she had to try very hard not to cry. But she eventually fell asleep the next morning, albeit to wake up to puffy eyes again the next morning that she knew would be commented on at work.

Work went in much the same direction as it had the day before, strange stares directed her way by her co-workers, and a general quietness pervading Hannah's office. She didn't get a thing done at work, instead re-reading the same sentances over and over, never being able to grasp their meaning.

She had never been more ready to leave than she was at the end of her workday. She knew that she was setting herself up for disappointment in thinking that there would be a message for her from Luis when she got home, but she rushed home a little faster than usual, and checked her voice mail as soon as she walked in the door.

"Hannah... Please call me, we need to talk," said a familiar voice through the phone.

Hannah's heart leapt as she heard his voice. Other than that short sentance followed by his phone number, he had nothing else to say. She found herself rationalizing over whether or not to call him.

On the one hand, he had treated her badly, she thought, and he hadn't called her until a day and a half after the incident had occured, and hadn't even sounded all that sorry.

On the other hand, he had called, though late, and did want her to call him back, and he HAD been her best friend nearly all her life.

She didn't want to seem too desperate, so she waited until 8:43 that night. She picked an odd number so that he wouldn't know that she had been waiting at home cleaning and working on projects to bide time until she thought that she could safely call him without seeming desperate.

She dialed the number with shaking hands and palpitating heart and waited nervously through the first three rings until Luis picked up on the fourth.

"Hello?"

"Um, Luis?"

"Hannah? Is that you?"

"Yeah.... what's up?"

"Can I come over?"

"Well... I guess."

This was unexpected. Hannah had already changed into her pajamas, and though her house was mostly immaculatlely spotless, there were chocolate candy wrappers all over the floor as well as the kleenexes with which she had used to wipe the teary mascara streaks off her face.

"Okay, I'll be right over."

"Okay.... Bye."

"Bye, Hannah."

As soon as she hung up the phone, Hannah hurriedly picked up all of the candy wrappers and kleenexes and threw them away, and then ran into her bedroom to change into something that would make Luis feel like he was missing out on much more than just a good buddy.

When she heard the doorbell ring, she was just putting on a fresh coat of lipstick, and she intentionally waited a few seconds longer to answer the door so that it wouldn't look like she had been waiting impatiently for Luis.
11221111112121211.title: The Anticipation of the Explanation

112211111121212111.content:
Hannah opened the door and smiled at Luis as though nothing were wrong. He looked at her as though he were kind of surprised at her smile, but came in and gave her a half-hearted smile anyway.

"Have a seat," Hannah said, and pointed to her sofa.

Luis complied and Hannah sat in the chair across from him, neatly crossing her ankles and still trying to appear as though nothing unusual had happened.

"Hannah..." he started, "We need to talk."

"About what?" Hannah asked, semi-cheerfully.

"Hannah, please don't do that."

"Do what?"

"Act as though nothing has happened. Geez, it's like high school all over again."

"I'm sorry..." Hannah said, looking down at the floor intently.

"Look, I will admit that Katy and I dated for a very short time while we were in college. She is not all there, and when she found out that I was moving to New York, she got it into her head that she wanted to move here too. She ran into me the other day when I was out running errands, and I only gave her my phone number because I couldn't lie to her. She must have gotten my address from the phone book, because I swear to you that I did not invite her over, nor did I ever ask to see her again. Hannah, please believe me."

"Why should I believe you Luis? You remember the summer after our senior year. How can you tell me that I should trust you after that?

"Geez, Hannah, that was four years ago! I was gettin ready to go to college and it scared me that we were going to be apart for so long. I made a big mistake and I knew it then and I know it now. Please don't make me pay for that mistake for the rest of my life."

"Stop being dramatic," Hannah said, suddenly.
112211111121212111.title: The Beginning of the Conversation

1122111111212121111.content:
There was complete silence as both Hannah and Luis looked down at the ground for several minutes without looking at each other at all.

"Hannah," Luis continued, "All I can give you is my word. Look at me."

Hannah looked up at Luis, who was staring intently at her.

"I swear to you that nothing is going on with Katy and I. I promise you that I did not give her my address, and that I did not know she was coming over, and I am telling the truth when I tell you that she left right after you did. And what's more, I did call you, several times, after you left, but like I said, I just couldn't think of the words to leave on your voice mail."

Hannah looked at Luis critically for a moment. She felt very vulnerable at this point, for to admit she was upset was to admit that she had feelings for Luis, and he had not yet done the same for her. It was too late to retract her overreaction, and she knew it, but she also knew that it would be better to have her feelings out in the open than to hide them only to get hurt later.

"Well?" Luis asked, "You forgive me?"

Luis gave Hannah a little smile. He had known Hannah long enough to know when she had forgiven him, and recognized her expression as such.

But Hannah didn't know if she was ready yet. She returned Luis's smile with one even smaller, but followed it with the movement of her eyes off of Luis and down onto the floor. Luis frowned. He knew that he hadn't yet won complete forgiveness, despite what he thought had been a forgiving look on Hannah's face.

He got up off the couch and kneeled down in front of Hannah and put one of his hands on each of her cheeks so that he could force her to look at him. Hannah looked at him in surprise and instinctively tried to pull away, but he held her in place.

"Hannah, I have given you the truth, and now I want some from you. Do you believe me, or do you not believe me?"

Hannah looked straight into his eyes.

"I believe you."

Luis smiled at her and wrapped his arms around her and held her close.

"Look, Hannah, I know that we have been best friends for all our lives, and except for a few occassions, we have always been completely honest with each other, and that's why I need to be honest with you now. I came to New York to find you. All those years in college were just years without having you in my life. I know it's soon to say this, but I want to work things out with you again. We belong together."

Hannah smiled to herself and rubbed her face against his shoulder to wipe her tears off.

Luis pulled away and kissed her forhead.

"What do you think?" he asked.

Hannah didn't answer, but instead smiled at him and then buried her face against his chest. Luis smiled in return and wrapped his arms around her once again.
1122111111212121111.title: The Admission of Like

11221111112121211111.content: Hannah and Luis dated for three years after that, and though the passion they started out with eventually faded slightly, they had begun their relationship as best friends, and best friends they remained. They were married at the age of 25 in a large ceremony which included everyone from both sides of the family, as well as all the friends from high school and college that knew them both. They had four children - three boys and a girl, and they lived tolerably ever after.
11221111112121211111.title: The Ending

choices: She comes it and finds him dead
She makes it before he dies
1122111111212122.content:
"He said this," she said, pressing the button again.
"Hey, Hannah, I think I need to explain," his voice said loudly. Hannah glared at it.
"Yes you do," she yelled.
"See Katy was the last girl I tried to date. She followed me all the way up here. She still 'loves' me and I really wish she didn't. I love you, Hannah. I'm sorry. She's an ass. I love you, not her. Please forgive me and come over tonight. Love you."
Anna pressed the NEXT button.
"Hannah, please talk to me. Don't you understand? I am dying over here without you. PuhLEEEZE??"
"Hannah, why won't you call back? I love you and if you don't love me why should I even be alive? Thanks to the guys and how they've all left me you're all in this fucking world I have."
Hannah was horrified. She heard a clanking in the background.
"Goodbye, Hannah."
She let out a slight scream of fright and raced out the door, and down to her car. She could tell in his voice he was serious. Anna was left in Hannah's house, but oh well.
1122111111212122.title: Messages

11221111112121222.content:
She burst into the unlocked dwelling of Luis's, and found his on the couch in tears, his heart shattering more with every sob. He was murmuring her name loudly under his breath. SHe noticed he held two bottles in his hand, one of strong pills and one of beer. He started debating on whether or not to take his life.
"I shouldn't do this... yes I should. Hannah doesn't care. She used to be my best friend... no, I can't... I still love her..."
It was this factor that made her choke out, "Put it down, Luis."
He leapt up, enraged. "WHAT ARE YOU DOING IN MY HOUSE? GET OUT OF HERE! I LOVED YOU WITH MY HEART AND SOUL AND YOU TOOK IT FROM ME BECAUSE OF SOMETHING THAT WASN'T MY FAULT! GET OUT AND NEVER EVER COME BACK!"
Besides frightening Hannah he also frightened himself. She turned and ran, hearing him collapse on the ground in horrible tremors of sobs. She fiddled with the door, and finally made it to her car. Just as she left for her apartment, she thought about this. Luis: her bloomed flower, she was sure was still eternal through all he had been through. She turned around and headed back to the place where only a few seconds ago she had wanted to get out of her life forever.
She opened the door to see him nearly unconcious with heart-breaking sobs. She was sobbing too.
"Luis, I'm here," she sobbed. He looked up to see if it was true, and a terrific grin lit up his face, and he jumped on top of her and smothered her with kisses of relief. She let him kiss her, for it was calming them both down.
11221111112121222.title: Frightened

choices: They resume what they were doing
112211111121212221.content:
They lay there on the floor, kissing passionately and slowly calming down. When at last they were calm, she rested her head on his chest.
"I'm sorry, Luis," she moaned, starting to cry.
"No, it's my fault."
"No, I should have-"
"Don't talk. Just let me kiss you. I've missed you so much these last couple days."
He pressed his mouth to hers and kissed her deeply. Then Katy walked in. She leapt onto Luis and tore them apart, and savagely tried to kiss him. He threw her down as Hannah lay on the ground, shaken.
"GET OUT, KATY, AND DON'T COME BACK!" he yelled. She smacked him and left him for the last time.
112211111121212221.title: Katy

choices: He asks for a tour of her apartment
1122111112.content:
Hannah looked at her diamond watch and gasped at the time. "Wow, look at the time!" She showed her wrist-watch to Luis, and he gasped.

"Do you want to come back to my house?" Hannah asked, admiring a small landscape of a volcano.
         "Sure, I'll go!" Luis agreed, and they linked hands.

~()~


"Wow, nice place!" Luis complimented, fiddling with a plant on the table. Hannah put her bag on the table and took out a chocolate chip biscuit from the jar. She bit into it and offered a biscuit to Luis. He took one out of the jar and bit into it.
         "I can see you dyed your hair!" Luis said.
"Oh, yeah! I wanted a change." Hannah ran her fingers through her bright blonde hair. It used to be a glossy brunette colour.
         "Looks nice. So, erm, how was University?"
"Oh, it was ok. I'm studying to be a graphic designer."
         "Really? Cool, where did you go?"
"Here!" Hannah finished off her biscuit and wiped up the crumbs. "New York!"
         "Wow. I wish I could afford that."
"Why, where did you go?"
         "California."
"Cool!"
1122111112.title: Stories

choices: Anna and her date is at the door.
Her neighbour (the old lady) brings her grandson to meet Hannah..that is..Luis!
112212.content:
On hearing the doorbell, Hannah felt somethings strange..new..it was the first time someone knocks the door of her own house..her heart started beating faster than usual..she was excited and scared at the samr time..thinking 'should i ask who it is before i open the door..or will i look like a little scared girl...no..i'll just open the door simply..but what if it's a stranger..NY is a big city full of bad people..oh god what to do!' Hannah wonders while standing still at her place..the knock stopped for about 20 seconds..but then back..it's knocking again..she stopped hesitataing, went right to the door and opened with her beautiful angelic smile..it's an old lady..at her early 70's..she's so old and pretty..she must have been a gorgeous young lady one day.. "hi! i'm your neighbour..i know you've just arrived few hours ago..i wanted to welcome you personally..i love having neighbours!! and i thought you must be tired cleaning and unpacking your bags so i brought you that mug of hot chocolate help you relax..i'm sorry for disturbibg.." The lady talks too much non-stop! Hannah thought..but she's so sweet and kind..Hannah felt so comfortable having someone like this lady living next to her..she felt as if that lady was her mother..sister..someone so close to her that will be there for her whenever she needed..it was a nice feeling that Hannah really needed at that time..as much as she needed that mug of hot chocolate, although she never thought of making herself one! she was so happy with it like a little baby..
Hannah treated the old lady so gently and thanked her for everything, she also told her that she's pass by her every now and then to see if the lady needs anything.She could recoginze that the lady lived all by herself, and that fact raised the feeling of empathy inside her towards that old lady.They said goodbye nicely and the woman entered her appartement waving goodbye to Hannah like a little child waving goodbye to his mother.

Hannah closed the door with the mug in her hands, she sat back on the couch..ahh..finally relaxing...looking at the mug..drinking slowly..Hannah remembered that day, with luis, back at the final week of school..it was a cold day..luis made them both hot chocolate..and they both sat on their favorite rock by the sea..getting warm together..watching the sunset as they always used to do..they enjoyed it each it day even more than the day before..every sunset was like a new experience to them as if it was the first time for them to see the sun going down..it wasn't the sunset that made them happier..it was their love that grew stronger everyday..it was that rope that tie their souls with love and devotion..it was their love that kept the fire of passion between them..

"Is it good or too sweet?" luis asked.
"Yummy..it's perfect baby..just like everything you do " Hannah said with a smile that she knows he cannot resist..he held her so tight, kissed her at forhead..and kept his arm arournd her..to enjoy being that close to her..
"know what luis, i've been thinking that other day..can you believe we have only one week left in school..and it will be over.." Hannah said.
"Yeah..years passed by really fast." Luis said looking at the sun going down..as if it's taking all their sweet school memories with down..drowning so deep with her..luis's mind was busy searching for answers for many questions that hannah asked him by her eyes...questions about the future..at that time he turned to Hannah, found her looking at him with her eyes full of tears..he knows that look..it's when Hannah's afraid or scared of something..or when she thinks about the future..Hannah always get scared when she thinks about the future..and Luis couldn't bear that look, he wanted to wipe all her fears away..and protect her..and quickly he said " Hannah..baby you know how much i love you don't you?..that love is unbreakable sweetie..we'll be together after school ..everyday..we'll watch every sunset and drink hot chocolate evryday..till the last sunset of my life...nothing can ever take me away from u ..be sure of that"
"but what if we ended up in dfferent colleges far from each other?" Hannah asked with her blue eyes sparkling..
Luis had no answer for that question..and he also couldn't leave her with that fear inside her..so again he kissed her forhead..and held her so tight..trying to protect her..from the future..as if it was a monster trying to take her away from him..
It was the first time they couldn't catch the moment the sun touches the sea..they missed it..the sun just drowned before they could say goodbye...darkness began to fall...
Hannah opened her eyes..heard knocking on the doar..she stood up..with the mug in her hands..going to the door..this time she didn't hesitate..she just decided to open without asking..and this time..she wasn't smiling..she was swimming in the sea of memories...
112212.title: Memories of hot chocolate!

11222.content:
And yet again the doorbell rings. For lord's sake! she screams to herself silently. Can't the world just leave her alone and let her shower! But what can she do? and opens the-just-closed-by-Anna door.
But no one is there. How odd, she thinks to herself, and then remembers the warnings she received earlier that day about the young building practical jokers. As she turned to close the door, she sees the reason for the interruption. A simple letter. Curious she lifts the letter from the ground and steps into her apartment. Sitting down, she opens the lid and finds a hand-written letter.
She quickly scans the words written there and blushes a deep and vibrant red. It's a love poem and letter declaring someone was deeply smitten with her. It gave very little clue of who it could be from but Hannah, being a very resourceful woman, knew she could find the author. Ha! she says to herself! wait 'till i tell this to Anna! She's not the only one with a love interest! Throughly pleased with herself, she sighs, put the letter away in a (well placed, might i add) drawer and goes to take a shower. The letter had only taken up about 15 minutes of her time but it was already it was 6:15 and she was starving, she wanted to eat before Anna's 'hot date' arrived.
11222.title: The Letter

info.brief_description: Is the passion they thought they had still burning after college?
info.description:
Hannah and Luis believed they had found love when they found each other. They considered themselves a couple. They ended up in different colleges at far ends of the U.S. It's four years later, at twenty-one, they go out and look for jobs, and unexpectedly bump into each other...literally. With the years spent apart, is their passion still burning for each other?

Characters

Hannah Denny - She's 21, blonde hair, bright ravishing blue eyes. She went off to a University in New York City, where she decided to become an graphic designer. She decides to stay in NYC, and try to find a job for herself. She hasn't forgotten her best friend Luis, and the two years they found themselves, finding they had true passion for each other. She wonders if maybe there would be any left if she saw him again. They hadn't really contacted the years they were in school.

Luis Armstrong - He's 21, and freshly out of college. He studied to become an architect. He went to a University in California, and believes that there's a place out there for him to find a career. He decides that maybe the great NYC is the place to begin looking. He still has he lushious dark hair, dark eyes, and gorgeous tan. Add some muscles, and a few more inches (now 6'4), and he's a hell more handsome than he was four years before, the last time he saw Hannah. He remembers the spark of passion they created when they found each other. He wonders if she still remembers that, or him.
